newsitem.title: UK: UK broker Lambert forms German joint venture.
newsitem.headline: UK broker Lambert forms German joint venture.

text.p: Insurance broker Lambert Fenchurch Group Plc said on Tuesday it was forming a joint venture in general insurance broking with Pantaenius GmbH & Co of Germany.
Lambert Fenchurch will acquire a 40 percent stake in Pantaenius, the company said in a statement.
Pantaenius is headquartered in Hamburg and is one of the leading yacht insurers in Europe, but has developed a general insurance broking arm.
The yacht insurance broking part of the company will remain wholly under the ownership of its chairman Harald Baum.
Lambert Fenchurch will pay 4.5 million marks for the stake in Pantaenius plus the share capital of Lowndes Lambert Deutschland AG.
The German joint venture follows a similar deal in the U.S. last month, when Lambert Fenchurch teamed up with Reliance and MTS Insurance Services.
Unaudited accounts showed Pantaenius' 1996 general insurance brokerage at 7.8 million marks and a pre-tax profit of 955,000 marks.
Lambert Fenchurch Group was formed earlier this year by the merger of Lowndes Lambert and Fenchurch Plc.
